name: Craft Wand Improved - No Exp cost
author: DoesntPlayAnymore

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
The original version (not by me, found here: https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... d-improved) made some cool changes to the Craft Wand feat.
"This script un-randomizes the number of charges and makes the wand cost a proportional fraction of the "50 charge" version.  The number of charges is always 10 + Caster Level and the cost is (10 + Caster Level) / 50 times the normal cost.
I made some changes to this:
  1. Charges now rely on Character level instead of Caster level - much better for multiclassed Casters.
  2. No exp cost for Craft Wand, Brew Potion and Scribe Scroll.
  3. Gold cost at 110% for balance.
UPDATE V2.0, Jun 29 2019: Variables can now be changed in iwd_conf.2da : The 10 base charges, whether to use Caster or Character level for charges, Gold Cost Ratio and XP Cost Ratio can all be edited to your liking.

That's it! All credit goes out to the original author - I just made these small tweaks. Enjoy crafting, brewing and scribing without fear of being underleveled in your single player modules!

Link: https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... o-exp-cost

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote: EXP cost makes no sense to me.  Why would using your skills make you forget?
It doesn't, from a real-world perspective.

But they had to use something as a counter-balance or else you would craft infinite wands, potions & scrolls.

Back in 1st & 2nd edition, crafting GAVE you exp. instead, but you were pretty much at the mercy of the DM as far as ingredients go.
